newsitem.title: USA: Microcom says CEO Pampel to retire.
newsitem.headline: Microcom says CEO Pampel to retire.

text.p: Microcom Inc said Friday its president and chief executive, Roland Pampel, will retire January 24.
Pampel, 62, has held the two posts since March 1994. He will continue to be a director of the company, which makes network access products, Microcom said.
He will be replaced as president and CEO by Lewis Bergins, currently executive vice president of operations, it said.

Bergins joined the company in 1982 as a vice president of operations and is curently responsible for Microcom's modulation business unit, international sales and corporate strategic alliances, it said.
Bergins will also become a director of the company, it said.
